page.title: 15ATTITUDES YOUNG AND ELDERLY
page.content: Teenagers do not, on the whole, like living in this area .It is too far from town for shopping,school and work.In addition there are few entertainments and amusements,such as discos,provided for young people in the villages.There used to be a youth club in Bredgar but it closed due to lack of numbers.Elerly people tend to like living in the area. It is peaceful,quiet, with abundant wildlife and is a pleasant place to spend their last years.They appreciate the sense of community which still exists,most often centred on the local church.Local organisations such as the Women's Institute and Bredgar Singers arrange activities which the elderly appear to enjoy.Both young and old complain about public transport.It is too infrequent,expensive and does not serve all the villages in the area.
